summary: This document is a deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell, conducted as part of a civil lawsuit involving plaintiffs Sheldon Barr and Thomas Gardner against the City of New York and 116 East 65th Street, LLC. Maxwell discusses her ownership of the property at 116 East 65th Street, her residency, and her business activities related to Ellmax, LLC. This deposition features Ghislaine Maxwell discussing the formation and ownership of 116 East 65th Street, LLC, including details about its creation, members, and the property it owns. Maxwell also addresses her personal assistant's role and various aspects of her financial and tax filings related to the LLC. This deposition features Ghislaine Maxwell discussing the layout and features of her former residence at 116 East 65th Street, New York. She provides details about the office space within the house, her business activities, and the Terramar Project, a non-profit organization she founded. The document also touches on the sale of the property and related tax returns. This deposition features Ghislaine Maxwell discussing her business activities related to Ellmax, LLC and the Terramar Project, as well as her residence at 116 East 65th Street. Maxwell clarifies that her home was primarily a residence and not used for business purposes, and she details the lack of revenue generated by Ellmax during its operation. This document appears to be a court filing related to the Epstein case, containing various references to individuals, events, and legal proceedings. It includes mentions of evidence, testimonies, and procedural details relevant to the ongoing investigation. This document appears to be a correction or errata sheet related to a deposition or hearing in the Epstein case. It includes references to testimony and corrections that need to be made to the transcript. The document is filed in New York County and is part of the ongoing legal proceedings.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell owned the property at 116 East 65th Street, which was her primary residence as of September 2015.
Maxwell has lived at her London address since approximately 1992 or 1993.
She was involved in business activities through a company named Ellmax, LLC, which she formed to advise companies on board placements.
Maxwell stated that she was not currently employed and had not been employed since her work with Ellmax.
The deposition took place as part of a civil lawsuit involving claims against the City of New York and 116 East 65th Street, LLC.
Ghislaine Maxwell formed 116 East 65th Street, LLC in 2000.
Darren Indyke, a lawyer referred by Jeffrey Epstein, assisted in the creation of the LLC.
The LLC purchased the property at 116 East 65th Street for approximately $6,000,000.
Maxwell had a housekeeper named Maritsa who worked for her five days a week in 2015.
Maxwell filed income taxes in the United States, including state and city taxes.
Ghislaine Maxwell confirmed that the office in her home was used for personal and business purposes.
The Terramar Project was established by Ghislaine Maxwell in 2011 or 2012.
Maxwell stated that she did not conduct business out of her residence at 116 East 65th Street.
The house was sold on April 14, 2016, for approximately $15.05 million.
Maxwell indicated that she did not have any salaried employees for the Terramar Project.
Ghislaine Maxwell stated that her home at 116 East 65th Street was primarily a residence and not used for business purposes.
Ellmax, LLC was dormant after 2013 and did not generate significant revenue during its operation.
Maxwell confirmed that she did not entertain clients or conduct business from her home between 2010 and 2013.
Monte Albers De Leon was authorized to attend the closing of the property sale on Maxwell's behalf.
Maxwell indicated that the address of 116 East 65th Street was used for convenience in relation to her business entities.
The document contains extensive references to Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, indicating their central roles in the case.
There are mentions of various legal proceedings and testimonies related to the allegations against Maxwell and Epstein.
The filing includes procedural details relevant to the ongoing investigation and legal actions.
The document is a correction/errata sheet for a deposition taken in the Epstein case.
It was filed in New York County on March 5, 2020.
The document includes instructions for correcting testimony in the transcript.
